p: Ou-Yahia et al. [ 67] assessed the antibacterial effect of the T. satureioides aerial part EOs against E. coli, Bacillus cereus, P. aeruginosa, Salmonella typhimurium, S. aureus, Micrococcus luteus, and Bacillus subtilis and showed a variable antibacterial activity of the tested EOs. The highest activity was observed against B. cereus and S. aureus with MIC values of 0.015% and 0.03%, respectively, while P. aeruginosa was the most resistant bacterium with a MIC value of 1%.
